title: Payload body
summary: The HTTP message payload body is the information ("payload") part of the data that is sent in the HTTP Message Body (if any), prior to transfer encoding being applied. If transfer encoding is not used, the payload body and message body are the same!

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
